title: Understanding Data Validity
text: Data validity ensures that the data is accurate, consistent, and reliable for analysis.

hintAnswer: A valid EmployeeID should be unique, $$non-null$$, and follow a consistent format.
title: Identifying Valid EmployeeID
text: What characteristics should a valid EmployeeID have?
choices: A valid EmployeeID should be unique, $$non-null$$, and follow a consistent format.
A valid EmployeeID should be a positive integer and can be repeated.
A valid EmployeeID should be a string of any length and can be null.

hintAnswer: A valid HireDate should be a past date, formatted correctly, and $$non-null$$.
title: Checking HireDate Validity
text: What criteria should a valid HireDate meet?
choices: A valid HireDate should be a past date, formatted correctly, and $$non-null$$.
A valid HireDate can be any date, including future dates, and can be null.
A valid HireDate should be a string of any format and can be repeated.

title: Common Data Validity Issues
text: Common issues include duplicate IDs, incorrect date formats, and missing values.
